titleStmt.title: W. E. Hamilton et al. to Beriah Magoffin
CWG10222

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p: To his Excellency Gov. B. Magoffin

Your Petition E. H. Hamilton Most humbly solicits your Excellency to remit the fine imposed on him of $29.62 cents by a Justice of the peace of Carter County Kentucky it being the same fine which he has heretofore Petitioned Your Excellency to remit and Your Excellency respited the same for twelve months which will Soon expire

The undersig^n^ed Petitioners Joines in the prayer with said Hamilton and now ask that said fine be remitted, They Most respectfully represent that said Hamilton is a Married Man & has a considerable family to support, & is like the Most of other Men (he is poor) but he is a hard laboring Man, & is striving to Make a living for himself & family & he is a peaceable Man, seldom gets into difficulties & has not been in any since he was fined as stated in his former Petition to your excellency and he now throws himself upon your Mercy & humbly prayers that said fine be remitted & that all individuals be restrained from collecting the same. Yours Respectfully

March 27th 1861
W E Hamilton
Isaac Pelfrey
Thoms Jones
W M Jones
John pelfrey
Wesley Hill Jr
Samuel B. Gordon
John M Hill
John Bunyand
Wm Shumat
David K. Rice
